alert.note: Alert for Wilkes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 4:52AM EDT until June 20 at 5:45AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: .Thunderstorms with heavy rainfall continue to move north out of Caldwell and Alexander counties into Wilkes County resulting in an increased threat for flooding. Flood Advisory extended until 730 AM EDT this morning. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest North Carolina, including the following county, Wilkes. * WHEN...Until 730 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rapid rises on small creeks and streams likely during the next few hours from excessive rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 452 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen just since midnight. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Church Branch, Cub Creek, Bee Tree Branch, Big Warrior Creek, Cove Creek, Clear Branch, Bussels Creek, Cane Creek, Basin Creek, Beaver Creek and Camp Branch. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in an increased threat for flooding. Rapid rises on small creeks and streams are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Wilkesboro... Wilkesboro... Wilbar... Boomer... Mc Grady... Millers Creek... Buck... - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
